; Sat, 21 Oct 2023 04:22:01 +0800 US man found guilty of wife’s murder in row over Zombie House Flipping showhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/20/david-tronnes-guilty-murdering-wife-zombie-house-florida
;;2023-10-20T17:53:14Z;
;
;;Tronnes，55 岁，在定罪后被判处终身监禁。
;

;Shanti Cooper- 2018 年，特罗尼斯突然退出了与一部家庭装修电视连续剧制片人的会面，她的丈夫一直渴望在这部连续剧中出演该连续剧。几天后，她被殴打致死。

;

;本周，陪审团在 ;佛罗里达州;发现她的丈夫大卫·特罗尼斯 (David Tronnes) 犯有谋杀她的罪，因为他对她拒绝参加节目，他相信这可以让他们摆脱昂贵的房屋修缮费用。

;

;当地州检察官办公室周三定罪后，55 岁的特罗内斯被判处终身监禁。在;一份声明;中说道。为期六天的审判结束后，该案被定罪，审判中的可怕细节引起了全国的关注。

;

;库珀-特龙尼斯前夫所生的儿子杰克逊·库珀 (Jackson Cooper) 周三在继父宣判前在法庭上发表讲话，并比喻了他的继父母亲正在杀死“我心中的一个无法填补或修复的洞”。

; ;

;之后，库珀在 ;NBC; 报道的新闻发布会上，特龙尼斯的惩罚感觉“就像五年的挣扎和痛苦从我们肩上卸下了” ”。

;

;“他终于到达了现在的位置，内心感觉很好，”杰克逊·库珀谈到特隆斯时说道。 “我们可以继续前进，因为知道他在他应该在的地方 - 他应该在的地方。”

;

;39 岁的库珀-特朗尼斯 (Cooper-Tronnes) 于 2013 年在网上认识了特朗尼斯 (Tronnes)。她相信他继承了数百万美元，因此他搬家了。来自明尼苏达州，与她一起住在奥兰多的德莱尼公园。

;

;2015 年，Tronnes 支付了略高于 60 万美元的现金购买了他与 Cooper-Tronnes 合住的房子，并将其与母亲一起存入信托基金，< a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/david-tronnes-shanti-cooper-murder-case-orlando-zombie-house-flipping-48-hours/">;哥伦比亚广播公司新闻报道;。这对夫妇于 2017 年结婚，但 Tronnes 没有让他的妻子在维多利亚风格住宅的房产契上签字。

;

;尽管这个地方面积 4,000 平方英尺，包括一个游泳池和一间车库公寓，但据报道 Tronnes花了大约25万美元来翻新它。库珀-特朗尼斯在她的家庭办公室经营着一​​家利润丰厚的金融软件业务，她为翻修提供了资金。

;

;特朗尼斯没有工作，她负责监督翻修工作。检察官称，该项目最终失控，导致夫妻关系紧张，导致特罗尼斯睡在车库里，而他的妻子则住在该房产的一间卧室工作室里。

;

;最终，希望为了尽量减少损失，特隆尼斯给当地一位房屋装修商打电话，他出现在名为“僵尸房屋翻转”的真人秀节目中。该系列详细介绍了工作人员如何翻新形状最差的房屋（通常是废弃的房屋），希望将其出售以赚取利润。

;

;装修者基思·奥里 (Keith Ori) 告诉哥伦比亚广播公司，他已获得使用许可特隆斯一家参加演出。他最后一次与他们会面是在 2018 年 4 月，当时计划下个月开始拍摄，以确保他们都仍然愿意出现在节目中。

;

;“他们都同意并说，“是的，我们明白。”然后她就立即出发了，”奥里回忆道。 “我有一种感觉，她对他很生气。”

;

;当局证实，特罗尼斯于 2018 年 4 月 24 日在她的卧室里殴打并勒死了库珀-托尼斯。随后，他试图清理现场。并报告称，他发现妻子显然是摔倒后死在浴缸里的。他声称，当他发现库珀-特朗尼斯的尸体时，他花了一天的时间清洁和遛狗。

;

;法医在库珀-特朗尼斯身上发现的眼睛瘀伤、面部受伤和“血液证据”并不支持她的说法。检察官说，丈夫的故事。调查人员还表示，他们之所以怀疑，是因为特朗尼斯没有哭泣，也没有表现出对库珀-特朗尼斯之死感到痛苦的样子。

;

;当局收集了大约四个月的证据，然后才将特朗尼斯登记为谋杀妻子的罪魁祸首。他被指控犯有一级谋杀罪，审判于 10 月 12 日开始。

;

;听取检察官对 Tronnes 案件的陪审团审议了不到五个小时（相对较短的时间），然后宣布他有罪。 .

; Sat, 21 Oct 2023 03:22:01 +0800 Britney Spears cricticises ‘dumb and silly’ press coverage of her memoirhttps://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/oct/20/britney-spears-memoir-woman-in-me-criticism-response
;;2023-10-20T18:41:35Z;
;
;;2018 年的布兰妮·斯皮尔斯
;

;布兰妮·斯皮尔斯批评了媒体对其即将出版的回忆录的报道，并淡化了报道任何不和，并表示她的目的不是“冒犯任何人”。

;

;这位歌手的讲述一切的书《我里面的女人》于 10 月 24 日发行，发行前的报道强调了这本书的一些内容更大的揭露，包括她与贾斯汀·汀布莱克的关系细节以及她的监管。

;
;

;;相关：;;“因悲伤而失去理智”：布兰妮·斯皮尔斯详细介绍了 2008 年的崩溃回忆录;

;
;

;“我写书的目的不是以任何方式冒犯任何人！”斯皮尔斯在;社交媒体上分享的一份声明;中写道。 “那是当时的我……那是过去的事了！我不喜欢我正在阅读的头条新闻……这正是我四年前退出该行业的原因！这本书的大部分内容都是 20 年前的……我已经继续前进，从这里开始一切都是美丽的、干净的！我来这里就是为了在我的余生中以这种方式建立它！不管怎样，这就是最后的事情了，糟糕的事情发生了！”

;

;这本书的早期一瞥，来自《人物》杂志的摘录和《纽约时报》看到的早期版本，显示了这位歌手的写作关于;她和汀布莱克在一起时堕胎;（“我非常爱贾斯汀。我一直希望有一天我们能在一起组建一个家庭......如果这件事由我一个人决定，我永远不会这么做。”）以及对她在监管过程中受到的待遇的痛苦，损害了她的精神和身体健康（“被压在轮床上后，我知道他们可以随时限制我的身体。所以我同意了......我的自由换取了和孩子们一起小睡——这是我愿意做的交易”）。

;

;在她的声明中，这位歌手继续说道：“这实际上是一本我不知道需要的书。写下来……虽然有些人可能会被冒犯，但它让我对所有事情都了结，为了更美好的未来！希望我能启发那些在大多数情况下感到特别孤独或受到伤害或误解的人们！再说一遍，我写这本书的动机并不是要重述我过去的经历，而这正是媒体正在做的事情，这是愚蠢的！从那时起我就继续前进了！”

;

;今天还看到了;时间;该杂志发表了一篇关于斯皮尔斯如何描述她与科林·法雷尔的风流韵事的故事，称其为“为期两周的争吵”，因为两人“打得如此激烈，就像我们在街头打架一样”。

;

; 据报道，斯皮尔斯从西蒙与画廊旗下的 Gallery Books 获得了 1500 万美元的投资。 Schuster 在竞购战中获得了这本回忆录。

;

;《我身上的女人》将于 10 月 24 日发行，有声读物版本将由奥斯卡提名演员米歇尔·威廉姆斯朗读。

; Sat, 21 Oct 2023 02:52:02 +0800 Rolling Stones bring the noise to small New York club in surprise showhttps://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/oct/20/rolling-stones-album-new-york-surprise-show
;;2023-10-20T17:27:45Z;
;
;;Ronnie Wood、Mick Jagger 和 Keith Richards 在滚石乐队于纽约市 Racket NYC 举行的惊喜演出中表演周四。
;

;周四，长青摇滚乐队滚石乐队在曼哈顿俱乐部举行了一场惊喜演出，庆祝他们 18 年来首张原创音乐专辑的发行。

;

;在众多名人的观众面前受邀参加市中心俱乐部 Racket NYC 的嘉宾包括克里斯蒂·布林克利 (Christie Brinkley)、埃尔维斯·科斯特洛 (Elvis Costello) 和特雷弗·诺亚 (Trevor Noah)，滚石乐队凭借七首歌曲引起了轰动，其中四首来自哈克尼钻石 (Hackney Diamonds) 的新唱片。

;

;;米克·贾格尔;提到了滚石乐队多年来在纽约宣传新音乐的特技，包括在第五大道的平板卡车上表演。

;
;

;;相关：;;“你的孩子越多，你就越自由”：米克·贾格尔谈衰老、愤怒和怀念查理·瓦茨;

;
;

;他以 1970 年代朋克风格的歌曲《Shattered》开场向这座城市致敬，歌词是“我的大脑已经溅满了曼哈顿”。

;

;表演完新单曲《Angry》后，;贾格尔;指出对他的乐队成员说：“凡事都有第一次。”

;

;随着鼓手 Charlie Watts 于 2021 年去世，滚石乐队只剩下贾格尔、吉他手 Keith Richards 和 Ron Wood 的核心三人组。舞台上还有另外四位音乐家作为补充。

;

;哈克尼钻石乐队 (Hackney Diamonds) 的到来正值许多歌迷怀疑滚石乐队是否会再次推出新音乐的时候，它受到了评论家的好评，许多人注意到其清脆的音乐。乐队展现出的活力。

;

;这种活力在曼哈顿肉库区的演出中显而易见。在 Questlove 的开场 DJ 表演结束后，贾格尔在比他以前习惯的小得多的舞台上欢快地走来走去。现年 80 岁的他，行动起来就像年龄只有一半的人一样。在听完另一首朋克风格的歌曲《Bite My Head Off》后，他的舌头轻微地摆动着。

;

;“你可能对这首歌曲很熟悉，”在理查兹开始《Jumpin' Jack》的开场即兴演奏之前，贾格尔说道。 Flash，自这首歌发行以来的 55 年里，立即击败了数千个酒吧乐队尝试的版本。

;

;Lady Gaga 身着亮片栗色长裤套装，亮相重现她的二重唱 - 决斗，真的 - 与贾格尔谈论新的《Sweet Sounds of Heaven》。

; ;

;“纽约，滚石乐队！”她在离开前说道，并与贾格尔和理查兹交换了亲吻。

; Sat, 21 Oct 2023 02:22:02 +0800 ‘A lot on the line’: New Zealand’s youngest MP looks to Māori ancestors to build new futurehttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/20/a-lot-on-the-line-new-zealands-youngest-mp-looks-to-maori-ancestors-to-build-new-future
;;2023-10-20T18:00:24Z;
;
;;Hana-Rawhiti Maipi-Clarke 在上周的选举后进入议会，成为新西兰最年轻的议员。
;

;在新西兰议会任职的第一天，该国最年轻的政治家 Hana-Rawhiti Maipi-Clarke 直奔照片墙寻找她的祖先——第一位毛利人王室部长的照片。< /p>;

;“看到那张照片后，我感到如释重负，”迈皮-克拉克告诉《卫报》。 “[议会]议院对于女性、毛利人，尤其是年轻人来说非常难以承受——对我们来说有很多事情要做。”

;

;“他的照片是一个好兆头——我说，你必须有我的支持，”她说。

;
;

;;相关：;;新西兰工党将选票投向右翼也是左派——进步政策篝火的代价;

;
;

;年仅 21 岁的 Maipi-Clarke 在上周的议会选举中成为 170 年来进入新西兰议会的最年轻议员全国选举。在此过程中，她推翻了工党;Nanaia Mahuta;，该国最资深、最受尊敬的国会议员之一，他是第一位毛利人外交部长，并曾担任豪拉基-怀卡托选举;毛利选民;20年了。

;

;但是新手毛利党 - 或 Te Pāti Māori - 政治家并不是政治新手：这是她的血液中。

;

;还有 Maipi-Clarke 的曾曾曾祖父 Wiremu Katene - 他是第一位政治家1872 年担任毛利王国大臣——她的姨妈 Hana Te Hemara 负责 1972 年向议会提交毛利语请愿书；2018 年，她的祖父 Taitimu Maipi 因破坏约翰·汉密尔顿上尉的雕像而成为头条新闻。汉密尔顿市 - 抗议汉密尔顿的殖民遗产和对毛利人的残暴行为。

;

;Maipi-Clarke 来自亨特利 - 奥克兰和汉密尔顿之间的一个小镇 - 她在那里经营着一个马拉凯 - 一个毛利人社区花园，提供教育当地的孩子们会根据 Maramataka 进行园艺，或者按照毛利农历进行种植。她的简历掩盖了她的年龄，作为一名企业主，她还;写了一本书;，鼓励 rangatahi（年轻人）对星星和月亮感兴趣，以治愈自己。

;

;Maipi-Clarke 没有看到自己作为一名政治家，她将自己视为毛利语言、土地和传统知识的 kaitiaki（守护者），并相信现在是时候让新一代毛利人的声音被听到了。

;

; Maipi-Clarke 在 Instagram 上有 20,000 名粉丝，在 TikTok 上有 18,500 名粉丝，她了解她的受众。 “无论你是毛利人、太平洋岛民还是非毛利人，我们确实缺少向可能对政治没有任何了解的公众进行翻译，”她说。

;

;但是 Maipi-Clarke 很快就补充说，她在社交媒体上的竞选活动只是故事的一半。

;

;“我曾经在整个选民中与老一辈面对面交流......我真的相信我是用两种不同的策略开展两次竞选活动，它们同样重要。”

;

;“他们投票给了一个与他们相似的政党”

;

;迈皮-克拉克在豪拉基-怀卡托毛利选区获胜让许多人感到惊讶的是：民意调查预测马胡塔将保住席位。 Mahuta 对保留席位的信心如此之大，以至于她没有以名单议员的身份竞选工党——这些议员是从党的偏好名单上填补席位，而不是从选民中填补席位——因此，她 27 年的议会生涯结束了。

;

;“这令人惊讶，因为 Nanaia Mahuta 已担任该席位多年，是一项政治遗产，”资深毛利广播员、电视节目主持人和政治记者 Mihingarangi Forbes 表示。

;

;但《福布斯》补充道，迈皮-克拉克的胜利并非完全不可预测。不仅大约 75% 的毛利人年龄在 40 岁以下，而且豪拉基-怀卡托选区毛利人的平均年龄为 23 岁。

;

;迈皮-克拉克也代表了通过教育接受教育的第一代毛利人。毛利语言浸入式学校的三个阶段。

;

;《福布斯》称，她“绝对是这场运动的典范”。 “就像工会和工党、企业界和国家党一样，毛利沉浸感正在成为 Te Pāti Māori 背后的运动，”她说。 “我听到了，我在 T 恤上看到了它，我在 TikTok 上看到了它——人们正在谈论这场运动，而 Hana-Rawhiti 已经乘势而上。”

;

;Te Pāti Māori 拥有强大的影响力在选举中表现出色——赢得了七个毛利选民席位中的四个。一旦特别选票——海外或选民选民之外的选票——被计入在内，该党还可能以微弱优势获得另外两票。福布斯表示，Te Pāti Māori 的成功并不是因为惩罚工党的毛利议员，而是因为对变革的更大渴望。

;

;“我们擅长决定如何挑选领导人并确保您的投票发挥作用 - 他们投票给了一个看起来像他们、说话像他们的政党。”

;

;福布斯希望迈皮-克拉克——他面对;竞选期间的威胁和入室盗窃;，该竞选活动因种族诱饵指控而受到损害免受其他政党的影响——将受到更资深议员的保护。 “我不想让我的孩子进入议会，但 [Maipi-Clarke] 有着来自一个始终挺身而出的家族的斗志。”

;

;经过疯狂的一周的就职、媒体露面和会议，迈皮-克拉克已准备好面对未来。

;

;“对我来说，首要任务是建立我的选民......但重要的是......我认为这是毛利人在议会内外团结起来的绝佳机会为我们将面对的政府类型制定计划。”

; Sat, 21 Oct 2023 02:22:02 +0800 Chinese ship is focus of investigation into damaged pipeline, Finland sayshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/20/chinese-ship-is-focus-of-investigation-into-damaged-pipeline-finland-says
;;2023-10-20T18:04:24Z;
;
;;芬兰边防巡逻船在管道受损处附近的海上。
;

;芬兰警方称一艘中国船只的活动与涉嫌破坏的“时间和地点”一致;本月受损的芬兰和爱沙尼亚之间的一条管道;现在是他们调查的重点。

;

;在泄漏导致管道关闭后10 月 8 日波罗的海连接器管道发生事故后，芬兰当局一直在调查损失，他们称这是由“外部”活动造成的。

;

;周五，他们表示重点关注 Newnew Polar Bear 号货船，据报道，这艘货船今年归中国所有。据芬兰广播公司 YLE 报道，2017 年至 2022 年间，它被称为波罗的海 Fulmar。

;
;

;
;

;

;

;警方将尝试从海底深处的粘土中打捞该物体，以调查它是否与受损的管道相连。

;

;国家调查局本周表示正在调查 Newnew Polarbear 和一艘俄罗斯船只 Sevmorput，他们称事件发生时这两艘船都在该地区。

;

;在完成对天然气管道损坏的犯罪现场调查后，周四，该局的法证库正在对样本进行分析。

;去年，水下爆炸导致三处管道破裂。波罗的海管道负责将天然气从俄罗斯输送到西欧。

; Sat, 21 Oct 2023 02:22:02 +0800 Dutch throne on display for first time as monarchy tries to win back publichttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/20/dutch-throne-on-display-exhibition-as-monarchy-tries-to-win-back-public-netherlands

;
;;宝座由阿姆斯特丹中央车站和国家博物馆背后的建筑师 Pierre Cuypers 设计。
;

;随着共和情绪日益高涨，荷兰君主制寻求进一步向公众开放，荷兰王座首次从海牙 13 世纪的 Ridderzaal 移至展览中展出。

;

;天鹅绒软垫的木椅在罗宫 (Paleis Het Loo) 的《权力的权力》展览中占据中心舞台，; ;这是奥兰治-拿骚王朝的避暑胜地，一直使用到 20 世纪

;

;王座将于本周至三月期间展出，威廉-亚历山大国王将在其在 Ridderzaal（骑士厅）举行的议会开幕式上发表年度演讲时使用该王位。概述了政府来年的计划。

;

;尽管还有其他座位，但它通常被视为主要的王室所在地。

;

;Annette de Vries 博士，研究和收藏主管Paleis Het Loo 说：“每个人都知道王位，因为它每年在电视上出现一次，所以它是荷兰权力剧场的一部分。它本身不属于博物馆的物品，但出于这个场合，也因为这次展览的相关性，他们认为这是一个好主意。这是一件美妙的事情。这是一件了不起的事情。”

;

;Het Loo 位于阿珀尔多伦地区中部，因其宏伟而有时被称为“北方的凡尔赛宫”。它于 1984 年由威廉-亚历山大的母亲贝娅特丽克丝女王开设，作为博物馆和艺术画廊。

; ;

;今年，耗资 1.71 亿欧元（1.49 亿英镑）的扩建项目揭幕，展览空间达 5,000 平方米（53,820 平方英尺），其中包含记录荷兰人生活和时代的永久展览过去和现在的皇室成员。

;

;当前的王座由阿姆斯特丹中央车站和国立博物馆的建筑师 Pierre Cuypers 于 1904 年设计和建造。

;

;其新哥特式风格旨在融入对中世纪的 Ridderzaal 进行更广泛的翻修，这是由荷兰第一位女王威廉敏娜 (Wilhelmina) 在 19 世纪之交下令进行的，她从 1890 年统治直到 1948 年退位。

;

;该设计是一种认可荷兰历史的黄金时代，荷兰可以说是全球贸易大国。 Ridderzaal 再次进行翻修。

;

;德弗里斯对任何有关新展览试图在国王困难时期重新激发人们对荷兰君主制的兴趣和支持的说法一笑置之，因为国王的王室有欧元年度预算为 5500 万，使其成为欧洲最昂贵的预算之一。

; ;

;她说博物馆将远离政治辩论。 “我们是一个独立的国家博物馆。我们来这里不是为了支持或反对。我们正在讲述奥兰治家族五个世纪以来的故事，以及它如何与荷兰的历史联系在一起，如何与欧洲的历史以及欧洲的文化史联系在一起。”

; <近年来共和情绪的高涨可以追溯到威廉-亚历山大在 2020 年新冠疫情期间决定带家人去希腊度假的愤怒情绪，尽管希腊政府建议人们尽可能少旅行。

;

;三年前，根据益普索 (Ipsos) 的年度民意调查，四分之三的荷兰公众 (76%) 对国王有信心。去年，这一比例下降至47%。对君主制的总体支持率已降至 55%。

;

;本周，GroenLinks 和工党 (PvdA) 的成员投票决定将废除君主制纳入 11 月大选的联合宣言中。< /p>;

;

;博物馆进入王位可以被视为王室向公众开放的更广泛举措的一部分。;

;椅子将与其他物品一起展示，例如流行的《权力的游戏》系列中铁王座的复制品，以及来自阿散蒂帝国（位于现在的加纳）的阿散蒂王座。

;

;“我们以这样的问题结束展览，什么是未来？”德弗里斯说道。 “这是一个悬而未决的问题。当然，这不是我们能回答的。”

;

; Sat, 21 Oct 2023 01:52:02 +0800 Actor reporting on asylum seekers finds brother among arrivals in Canary Islandshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/20/actor-thimbo-samb-reporting-on-asylum-seekers-finds-brother-among-arrivals-in-canary-islands

;
;;Thimbo Samb 于 2020 年 12 月在电影首映式上拍摄，身穿黑色连帽上衣
;

;马德里一位演员前往加那利群岛报道了数量接近创纪录的寻求庇护者的到来，在发现他是数千名寻求庇护者中的一员后，他与他的兄弟团聚。 .theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/04/boat-canary-islands-el-hierro-spain-west-africa">;最近几周从塞内加尔到西班牙进行了一次危险的旅行;。

;

;Thimbo Samb and his team had arrived in the archipelago hoping to tell the story of the more than 23,000 asylum seekers who have turned up on its shores so far this year. But the Senegal-born actor's trip took a different turn after he learned that his older brother was among the many who had recently set off on the risky route.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Anger over fish stocks as Senegal village mourns boat disaster dead;

;
;

;His brother had kept the plans hidden, knowing Samb would disapprove. Instead it was Samb's mother who revealed – three days after his brother had embarked on the perilous journey – that his sibling was one of 248 people crammed into a heaving, rickety boat that was attempting one of the world's deadliest migration routes.

;

;“I was filled with fear,” said Samb. “I couldn't eat, I wasn't sleeping.”

;

;He described the days of waiting for news as scarier than when he had made the same crossing himself at the age of 17. For days he kept his eyes on his phone, willing it to ring. “You can't call anyone because there's zero communication with these boats.”

;

;The risks of the route were fresh in his mind: in August, more than 90 people who set off from near Samb's home town in Senegal ;were believed to have died; after their boat ended up drifting for more than a month at the mercy of the Atlantic's powerful trade winds.

;

;“Really, I wouldn't advise anyone to come by boat,” he said. “But I also understand why they do it.”

;
;

;;Related: ;;'There is no hope here': young Africans explain why they would risk death to leave home ;

;
;

;While nearly everyone from his home town of Kayar, a coastal city about 60km north of Senegal's capital, Dakar, had lost a loved one or acquaintance along the route, Samb said many continued to see a boat journey as the only means of securing a future as they grappled with unemployment, mounting political instability and a sense that there was little on offer for them in Senegal.

;

;So far this year, 23,537 asylum seekers have arrived in the Canary Islands – up 80% from the same period last year. In the first weeks of October, the number of arrivals climbed to ;near-record levels,; with about 4,000 people a week reaching the islands.

;

;Spain's acting migration minister, José Luis Escrivá, said this week that the central government was finalising a €50m aid package to help the Canary Islands cope with what ;he described; as an “extraordinary migration flow”.

;

;It was this increase in arrivals – many of whom are from Senegal – that had brought Samb to the Canary Islands with his team from ;The Migration Route,; an information portal. “We went to cover this and my brother happened to be there,” said Samb.

;

;Six days after the wooden fishing boat carrying his brother had set off from west Africa, news came that it had landed in El Hierro, the remote, westernmost island of the archipelago. “I gave my thanks to God, frankly, because there are so many people who don't make it,” said Samb.

;

;His brother was swiftly transferred to Tenerife, where Samb tracked him down and told him of plans to bring him to live with him. “In some ways he's going to have it a lot better than me – I slept on the streets for months [when I arrived], combing through rubbish bins so that I could eat,” he said. “But it's still not going to be easy, there's the paperwork, finding a job and racism. He'll have to suffer through all that.”

;

;Samb's warning came as the perils of what his brother had just survived were laid bare. Earlier this month a vessel carrying about 80 women, children and men had seemingly vanished after setting off from Senegal, sparking fears that their unstable vessel had succumbed to the fierce currents of the Atlantic.

;

;“It's been at sea for 12 days,” said Samb. “We're talking about mothers with toddlers, and so; ;far we've heard nothing, absolutely nothing, from them.”

; Sat, 21 Oct 2023 01:22:01 +0800 Labour declares historic byelection wins a ‘political earthquake’https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2023/oct/20/labour-declares-historic-byelection-wins-a-political-earthquake
;;2023-10-20T08:32:26Z;
;
;;Keir Starmer (right) celebrates with the newly elected Labour MP Alistair Strathern in Bedford.
;

;Keir Starmer has said that Labour is “redrawing the political map” as he carried out a triumphant tour to the site of two historic overnight byelection wins, as his party overturned huge Conservative majorities in ;Tamworth; and ;Mid Bedfordshire;.

;

;Standing next to Alistair Strathern, who overturned the Conservatives' near-25,000 majority under Nadine Dorries in Mid Bedfordshire, Starmer said the new MP had “made history here over the past 24 hours” with the scale of the win.

;

;The Labour leader then travelled to Tamworth to appear alongside the party's winning candidate there, Sarah Edwards, who overcame the Tories' 2019 majority of just under 20,000 to triumph.

;

;Speaking at a country park near Bedford, Starmer said Labour was “redrawing the political map” by taking seats such as Mid Bedfordshire, which had consistently returned Conservative MPs in every election since 1931.

;

;“We know that voters here have voted for us and they've put their trust and their confidence in a changed Labour party, and we will repay them for that trust and confidence,” he told assembled activists.

;

;“We do so humbly. And I know there are people yesterday who probably voted Tory in the past who voted for a changed Labour party because they despair at the state of their own party.

;

;“I'm glad that they see that our party is changed and they can put their trust and confidence in them, and I hope that that persuades other voters across the country who may have voted for other parties in the past, that the party of the future, the party of national renewal to reject the decline of the last 13 years, is this changed Labour party.”

; ;

;Labour secured a 24-point swing in Tamworth – its second-highest byelection swing ever – giving Edwards a 1,316-vote majority over her Tory rival, Andrew Cooper. The last time the party took the seat from the Conservatives was in 1996, when it was called South East Staffordshire. It won a 22-point swing in a result that foreshadowed the landslide general election victory the next year.

;

;In Mid Bedfordshire, Strathern achieved a 20.5-point swing to win a 1,192 majority over the Conservative candidate, Festus Akinbusoye. It was the biggest majority overturned by Labour since 1945.

; ;

;Both seats were being fought after controversial resignations from the sitting Tory MPs.

;

;In Mid Bedfordshire, Dorries had said she would resign after not being included in Boris Johnson's resignation honours, but then did not step aside ;for another 11 weeks;. The Tamworth byelection was called after the former deputy chief whip Chris Pincher quit, having lost an appeal against an eight-week suspension from parliament for groping two men at a private members' club.

; ;

;John Curtice, a professor of politics at the University of Strathclyde, said the results were “extremely bad news” for the Tories. “If you want to look at the precedent: what's the last time that we had swings of this order? The answer is the parliament of '92 to '97. There were four byelections in that in which Labour got swings of over 20% from the Conservatives, and we all know how that ended,” he said.

;

;The Conservative vote collapsed in both seats, taking the party from 66% to 41% in Tamworth and from 60% to 31% in Mid Beds.

; ;

;The Labour vote rose more moderately however, with tens of thousands of 2019 voters apparently choosing to stay at home. Turnout in Tamworth was little more than half the level at the 2019 general election, and in Mid Beds was about two-thirds of the 2019 level.

;

;The low turnout gave the Tories some hope that they may be able to recover some ground in time for the general election, which is likely to be held next year.

;

;Maria Caulfield, a health minister, said: “What I hear on the doorstep is they don't feel that Keir Starmer is an alternative solution. We're not seeing people voting for Labour in the way that they would need to form a government.”

;

;The Tory chair, Greg Hands, said: “I don't think a single person came to the door to say that despite all the problems people are facing, that Labour and Sir Keir Starmer were the solution to their problems.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Labour success will send chill through spines of Tory MPs;

;
;

;“I don't see any enthusiasm for Labour but clearly there's been a lot of, if you like, background circumstances in those two byelections that have also made the job difficult for us.”

;

;Conservative sources suggested the results would not prompt a change of strategy from Downing Street.

;

;Hands said: “We need to continue to deliver against our priorities and make sure that people see that Rishi Sunak is doing a very good job as prime minister.”

;

;The Liberal Democrats fell well short in Mid Beds, having expected to run Labour close. But the party celebrated an increased vote share in the seat, with a source saying “thousands of lifelong Tories” had switched their votes to the Lib Dems.

;

;A Texas judge has ruled that the Infowars host, Alex Jones, cannot use bankruptcy protection to ;avoid paying; nearly $1.5bn to families who sued over his conspiracy theories that the 2012 ;Sandy Hook school massacre; was a hoax.

;

;The decision is another significant defeat for Jones in the wake of juries in Texas and Connecticut punishing him over spreading falsehoods about the nation's deadliest school shooting. US district judge Christopher Lopez of Houston issued the ruling on Thursday.

;

;Jones filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection last year and more recent financial documents submitted by his attorneys put his personal net worth around $14m. But Lopez ruled that those protections do not apply over findings of “willful and malicious” conduct.

;

;“The families are pleased with the court's ruling that Jones's malicious conduct will find no safe harbor in the bankruptcy court,” said Christopher Mattei, a Connecticut lawyer for the families. “As a result, Jones will continue to be accountable for his actions into the future regardless of his claimed bankruptcy.”

;

;An attorney for Jones did not immediately return a message seeking comment on Friday.

;

;After 26 people were killed by a gunman at Sandy Hook elementary school in Newtown, Connecticut, in December 2012, Jones made a false conspiracy theory a centerpiece of his programming on his flagship Infowars show. He told his audience last year he was “officially out of money” and has asked them to shop on his Infowars website to help keep him on the air.

;

;But Jones's ;personal spending; topped $93,000 in July alone, including thousands of dollars on meals and entertainment, according to his monthly financial reports in the bankruptcy case. The spending stuck a nerve with Sandy Hook families as they have yet to collect any of the money that juries awarded them.

;

;Sandy Hook families won nearly the $1.5bn in judgments against Jones last year. Relatives of the victims testified at the trials about being harassed and threatened by Jones's believers, who sent threats and even confronted the grieving families in person, accusing them of being “crisis actors” whose children never existed.
